subject: Investing
title: Currency Risk: The Hidden Return Driver
description: A micro-lesson that makes Currency Risk: The Hidden Return Driver usable.

hook.text: A European fund gained 15% in local currency but only 5% for US investors after the euro weakened.

buildup.text: When you invest abroad, your return has two parts: the local asset return and the currency exchange rate change.

discovery.text: A strengthening foreign currency boosts your returns; a weakening one erodes themâ€”regardless of stock performance.

twist.text: Over decades, currency effects tend to wash out. Over shorter periods, they can dominate total returns.

climax.text: Long-term investors can accept currency volatility as diversification. Short-term investors may need to hedge.

punchline.text: Investing abroad is always a currency bet. Know it, even if you don't hedge it.

quiz.question: How does a weakening foreign currency affect your returns?
options: It erodes returns when converted back to your home currency
